Title: Tampa Bay Regional Travel Surveys
SideBarTextLeft:
The Tampa Bay Regional Travel Surveys (TBRTS) program is a comprehensive data collection program designed to support regional and local transportation modeling and transportation planning decisions. This visualization tool is provided regional stakeholders to explore and understand the regional Household Travel Survey and passive data Origin-Destination Tables – two components of the TBRTS.

The 2018-2019 Tampa Bay Regional Household Travel Survey collected data on daily travel throughout the five-county Tampa Bay region. Over 4,500 households and 9,000 people in Citrus, Hernando, Hillsborough, Pasco and Pinellas counties participated. Two-thirds of households were randomly invited through a mailed invitation (probability sample) and one-third through email, advertising, and community outreach efforts. Data were collected between October 2018 and April 2019, when both year-round and seasonal residents are in the region. Participants provided basic demographic details, answered questions about typical travel, and provided a one-day (online / telephone participants) or five-day (smartphone app participants) diary of all household travel.

The Origin-Destination Tables are derived from passively collected GPS and wifi-beacon location data known as Location Based Services (LBS). Raw LBS data consists of millions of device (typically smartphone) locations and timestamps without demographic or other details of the device owners. The raw data is processed by first cleaning, filtering, and analyzing the location data to identify trips, then crossing with other regional data sources such as surveys and traffic counts to estimate detailed regional travel patterns.

All data is shown as expanded and weighted to match a typical weekday of travel in 2018.

To learn more about the survey and its results please contact the Florida Department of Transportation, District 7.

ActivityViz was initially funded by the Atlanta Regional Commission with additional support from Oregon Metro and others.
SideBarTextRight: The survey was conducted by the Florida Department of Transportation District Seven with support from the region’s four metropolitan planning organizations (MPOs): Hernando-Citrus MPO, Hillsborough MPO, Pasco County MPO and Forward Pinellas.

GroupedCharts.name: Typical Travel
GroupedCharts.info: When people make trips in the region

content: Typical trip start and end based on observed (smartphone GPS diary) or reported (online diary) trips.
Based on trips observed / reported on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, or Thursdays only.
Peaks observed at 7-8am and 4-6pm (typical work commute times).
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Mark checkboxes to swap bars and legend, show graph as percentage, vertical, or stacked.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.

GroupedCharts.name: Trip Destination Activity
GroupedCharts.info: Destination Activities for daily trips made

content: Survey question (asked for each trip taken): "Why did you stop at ___?"
Trips to home, for shopping / erands, or to work account for over 70% of all trips.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove response categories.

Survey question (asked once per participant, if person is employed and has one work location or work location regularly varies): "How often do you typically telework (instead of going to work that day)?"
Over 30% of 18-34 year-olds telecommute at least once per week.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove response categories.
Survey question (asked once per participant): "How often do you use a bicycle?"
35-54 year-olds report the most frequent bike usage.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove response categories.
Age of survey participants.
55% of participants were 18-54 years old, while 45% were 55+ years old.
Hover mouse over bars to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove response categories.
Gender of survey participants.
Slightly more women than men participated in the survey.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Survey question (asked once per participant, if person is employed and has one work location or work location regularly varies): "How do you typically travel to your primary job?"
93% of people typically use cars to commute to work.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Each square in the graph represents 1% of the population.

Chord.name: Daily OD Flows
Chord.info: Daily trips OD by Districts for Passive and Survey Data

content: Origins and destinations of daily trips by Districts for passive and survey data.
Unsurprisingly, most inter-District trips were between Tampa and Hillsborough-Other.
Hillsborough County had the highest volume of trips overall.
Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
The color of connections between Districts depicts net travel (e.g., in the passive dataset, there were more trips from Tampa to Hillsborough-Other than there were in the opposite direction).
Frequency of trip modes by Transportation Analysis Zone (TAZ).
Tampa International Airport observed a high frequency of TNC trips.
The area around University of South Florida observed a high frequency of walk trips.
Use the drop-down selection to view different modes.
Use the control buttons to move around the map region.
Select "Show Data" to see tabulation.
Frequency of trip modes by county.
Over 80% of trips are car trips in all counties.
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove response categories.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the right graph: Use the drop-down selection to view different modes.

BarMap.name: Trip Mode for Seasonal Households
BarMap.info: Trips by mode by county for seasonal households

content: Frequency of trip modes by county for seasonal residents (those who report living in the region for fewer than 12 months per year).
Over 15% of seasonal residents' trips in Hillsborough and Pinellas counties are walking trips.
For the left graph: Select/deselect bubbles to add/remove response categories.
For the left graph: Hover mouse over graph to see detail.
For the right graph: Use the drop-down selection to view different modes.
